thread.title: The Shortlist top gigs: Airling, Last Dinosaurs, Olafur Arnalds, Sick of It All, Oxford Art Factory
thread.title_full: The Shortlist top gigs: Airling, Last Dinosaurs, Olafur Arnalds, Sick of It All, Oxford Art Factory

author: Bronwyn Thompson
title: The Shortlist top gigs: Airling, Last Dinosaurs, Olafur Arnalds, Sick of It All, Oxford Art Factory
text:
Steve Smyth performs at the Oxford Art Factory 8th Birthday. 
AIRLING 
Friday, October 9, Newtown Social Club, sold out 
It's been a meteoric rise for Hannah Shepherd – aka Airling – who has gone from bedroom productions to the Splendour in the Grass stage in next to no time. Crossing genres from RnB to East Coast hip-hop with ease, Airling is growing up fast and selling out venues regularly, and that includes this gig – watch this space.
LAST DINOSAURS
Friday, October 9, Enmore Theatre, ticketek.com.au 
A fitting soundtrack for summer, Last Dinosaurs' new album Wellness has been worth the wait for fans. Out now, the Brisbane indie-popsters are heading out around the country to celebrate. They play one of their biggest Sydney shows to date, with the excellent local melodic kings Palms in support. Tickets available for $39.95.
Advertisement OLAFUR ARNALDS
Saturday, October 10, Sydney Opera House Concert Hall, sydneyoperahouse.com 
The Graphic music and arts festival is becoming one of the most exciting events on the Sydney calendar. One of the stand-outs on this year's line-up is the return of Icelandic musician Olafur Arnalds, who'll play with a 13-piece chamber orchestra and be accompanied by visuals from Mani Sigfusson. Expect a sensory immersion. Tickets from $49.
SICK OF IT ALL
Saturday, October 10, Manning Bar, oztix.com.au 
The punk legends certainly aren't sick of touring, with the band about to celebrate 30 years together. A huge influence to punk and hard core acts over the past three decades, the New Yorkers return to Australia to raise hell – in a nice way – at this own Sydney gig, on the back of most recent set Last Act of Defiance . Tickets are $42.
OXFORD ART FACTORY 8TH BIRTHDAY
Saturday, October 10, Oxford Art Factory, oxfordartfactory.com 
It's hard to believe it's eight years since Oxford Art Factory threw its doors open and became one of the city's premier stops for live music. To celebrate, the free annual party never disappoints. This year, catch Steve Smyth, Papa Pilko and the Binrats, Smaal Cats, Los Tones and Persian Drugs in the main room, with Flyying Colours, Two Age and more in the gallery room.
